73
74/* global vars */
75ipxcp_options ipxcp_wantoptions[NUM_PPP]; /* Options that we want to request */
76ipxcp_options ipxcp_gotoptions[NUM_PPP]; /* Options that peer ack'd */
77ipxcp_options ipxcp_allowoptions[NUM_PPP]; /* Options we allow peer to request */
78ipxcp_options ipxcp_hisoptions[NUM_PPP]; /* Options that we ack'd */
79
80#define wo (&ipxcp_wantoptions[0])
81#define ao (&ipxcp_allowoptions[0])
82#define go (&ipxcp_gotoptions[0])
83#define ho (&ipxcp_hisoptions[0])
84
85/*
86 * Callbacks for fsm code. (CI = Configuration Information)
87 */
88static void ipxcp_resetci __P((fsm *)); /* Reset our CI */
89static int ipxcp_cilen __P((fsm *)); /* Return length of our CI */
90static void ipxcp_addci __P((fsm *, u_char *, int *)); /* Add our CI */
91static int ipxcp_ackci __P((fsm *, u_char *, int)); /* Peer ack'd our CI */
92static int ipxcp_nakci __P((fsm *, u_char *, int, int));/* Peer nak'd our CI */
93static int ipxcp_rejci __P((fsm *, u_char *, int)); /* Peer rej'd our CI */
94static int ipxcp_reqci __P((fsm *, u_char *, int *, int)); /* Rcv CI */
95static void ipxcp_up __P((fsm *)); /* We're UP */
96static void ipxcp_down __P((fsm *)); /* We're DOWN */
97static void ipxcp_finished __P((fsm *)); /* Don't need lower layer */
98static void ipxcp_script __P((fsm *, char *)); /* Run an up/down script */
99
100fsm ipxcp_fsm[NUM_PPP]; /* IPXCP fsm structure */
101
102static fsm_callbacks ipxcp_callbacks = { /* IPXCP callback routines */
103 ipxcp_resetci, /* Reset our Configuration Information */
104 ipxcp_cilen, /* Length of our Configuration Information */
105 ipxcp_addci, /* Add our Configuration Information */
106 ipxcp_ackci, /* ACK our Configuration Information */
107 ipxcp_nakci, /* NAK our Configuration Information */
108 ipxcp_rejci, /* Reject our Configuration Information */
109 ipxcp_reqci, /* Request peer's Configuration Information */
110 ipxcp_up, /* Called when fsm reaches OPENED state */
111 ipxcp_down, /* Called when fsm leaves OPENED state */
112 NULL, /* Called when we want the lower layer up */
113 ipxcp_finished, /* Called when we want the lower layer down */
114 NULL, /* Called when Protocol-Reject received */
115 NULL, /* Retransmission is necessary */
116 NULL, /* Called to handle protocol-specific codes */
117 "IPXCP" /* String name of protocol */
118};
119
120/*
121 * Command-line options.
122 */
123static int setipxnode __P((char **));
124static void printipxnode __P((option_t *,
125 void (*)(void *, char *, ...), void *));
126static int setipxname __P((char **));
127
128static option_t ipxcp_option_list[] = {
129 { "ipx", o_bool, &ipxcp_protent.enabled_flag,
130 "Enable IPXCP (and IPX)", OPT_PRIO | 1 },
131 { "+ipx", o_bool, &ipxcp_protent.enabled_flag,
132 "Enable IPXCP (and IPX)", OPT_PRIOSUB | OPT_ALIAS | 1 },
133 { "noipx", o_bool, &ipxcp_protent.enabled_flag,
134 "Disable IPXCP (and IPX)", OPT_PRIOSUB },
135 { "-ipx", o_bool, &ipxcp_protent.enabled_flag,
136 "Disable IPXCP (and IPX)", OPT_PRIOSUB | OPT_ALIAS },
137
138 { "ipx-network", o_uint32, &ipxcp_wantoptions[0].our_network,
139 "Set our IPX network number", OPT_PRIO, &ipxcp_wantoptions[0].neg_nn },
140
141 { "ipxcp-accept-network", o_bool, &ipxcp_wantoptions[0].accept_network,
142 "Accept peer IPX network number", 1,
143 &ipxcp_allowoptions[0].accept_network },
144
145 { "ipx-node", o_special, (void *)setipxnode,
146 "Set IPX node number", OPT_A2PRINTER, (void *)printipxnode },
147
148 { "ipxcp-accept-local", o_bool, &ipxcp_wantoptions[0].accept_local,
149 "Accept our IPX address", 1,
150 &ipxcp_allowoptions[0].accept_local },
151
152 { "ipxcp-accept-remote", o_bool, &ipxcp_wantoptions[0].accept_remote,
153 "Accept peer's IPX address", 1,
154 &ipxcp_allowoptions[0].accept_remote },
155
156 { "ipx-routing", o_int, &ipxcp_wantoptions[0].router,
157 "Set IPX routing proto number", OPT_PRIO,
158 &ipxcp_wantoptions[0].neg_router },
159
160 { "ipx-router-name", o_special, setipxname,
161 "Set IPX router name", OPT_PRIO | OPT_A2STRVAL | OPT_STATIC,
162 &ipxcp_wantoptions[0].name },
163
164 { "ipxcp-restart", o_int, &ipxcp_fsm[0].timeouttime,
165 "Set timeout for IPXCP", OPT_PRIO },
166 { "ipxcp-max-terminate", o_int, &ipxcp_fsm[0].maxtermtransmits,
167 "Set max #xmits for IPXCP term-reqs", OPT_PRIO },
168 { "ipxcp-max-configure", o_int, &ipxcp_fsm[0].maxconfreqtransmits,
169 "Set max #xmits for IPXCP conf-reqs", OPT_PRIO },
170 { "ipxcp-max-failure", o_int, &ipxcp_fsm[0].maxnakloops,
171 "Set max #conf-naks for IPXCP", OPT_PRIO },
172
173 { NULL }
174};
175
176/*
177 * Protocol entry points.
178 */
179
180static void ipxcp_init __P((int));
181static void ipxcp_open __P((int));
182static void ipxcp_close __P((int, char *));
183static void ipxcp_lowerup __P((int));
184static void ipxcp_lowerdown __P((int));
185static void ipxcp_input __P((int, u_char *, int));
186static void ipxcp_protrej __P((int));
187static int ipxcp_printpkt __P((u_char *, int,
188 void (*) __P((void *, char *, ...)), void *));
189
190struct protent ipxcp_protent = {
191 PPP_IPXCP,
192 ipxcp_init,
193 ipxcp_input,
194 ipxcp_protrej,
195 ipxcp_lowerup,
196 ipxcp_lowerdown,
197 ipxcp_open,
198 ipxcp_close,
199 ipxcp_printpkt,
200 NULL,
201 0,
202 "IPXCP",
203 "IPX",
204 ipxcp_option_list,
205 NULL,
206 NULL,
207 NULL
208};
209
210/*
211 * Lengths of configuration options.
212 */
213
214#define CILEN_VOID 2
215#define CILEN_COMPLETE 2 /* length of complete option */
216#define CILEN_NETN 6 /* network number length option */
217#define CILEN_NODEN 8 /* node number length option */
218#define CILEN_PROTOCOL 4 /* Minimum length of routing protocol */
219#define CILEN_NAME 3 /* Minimum length of router name */
220#define CILEN_COMPRESS 4 /* Minimum length of compression protocol */
221
222#define CODENAME(x) ((x) == CONFACK ? "ACK" : \
223 (x) == CONFNAK ? "NAK" : "REJ")
224
225static int ipxcp_is_up;
226
227static char *ipx_ntoa __P((u_int32_t));
228
229/* Used in printing the node number */
230#define NODE(base) base[0], base[1], base[2], base[3], base[4], base[5]
231
232/* Used to generate the proper bit mask */
233#define BIT(num) (1 << (num))
234
235/*
236 * Convert from internal to external notation
237 */
238
239static short int
240to_external(internal)
241short int internal;
242{
243 short int external;
244
245 if (internal & BIT(IPX_NONE) )
246 external = IPX_NONE;
247 else
248 external = RIP_SAP;
249
250 return external;
251}
252
253/*
254 * Make a string representation of a network IP address.
255 */
256
257static char *
258ipx_ntoa(ipxaddr)
259u_int32_t ipxaddr;
260{
261 static char b[64];
262 slprintf(b, sizeof(b), "%x", ipxaddr);
263 return b;
264}
265
266
267static u_char *
268setipxnodevalue(src,dst)
269u_char *src, *dst;
270{
271 int indx;
272 int item;
273
274 for (;;) {
275 if (!isxdigit (*src))
276 break;
277
278 for (indx = 0; indx < 5; ++indx) {
279 dst[indx] <<= 4;
280 dst[indx] |= (dst[indx + 1] >> 4) & 0x0F;
281 }
282
283 item = toupper (*src) - '0';
284 if (item > 9)
285 item -= 7;
286
287 dst[5] = (dst[5] << 4) | item;
288 ++src;
289 }
290 return src;
291}
292
293static int ipx_prio_our, ipx_prio_his;
294
295static int
296setipxnode(argv)
297 char **argv;
298{
299 u_char *end;
300 int have_his = 0;
301 u_char our_node[6];
302 u_char his_node[6];
303
304 memset (our_node, 0, 6);
305 memset (his_node, 0, 6);
306
307 end = setipxnodevalue (*argv, our_node);
308 if (*end == ':') {
309 have_his = 1;
310 end = setipxnodevalue (++end, his_node);
311 }
312
313 if (*end == '\0') {
314 ipxcp_wantoptions[0].neg_node = 1;
315 if (option_priority >= ipx_prio_our) {
316 memcpy(&ipxcp_wantoptions[0].our_node[0], our_node, 6);
317 ipx_prio_our = option_priority;
318 }
319 if (have_his && option_priority >= ipx_prio_his) {
320 memcpy(&ipxcp_wantoptions[0].his_node[0], his_node, 6);
321 ipx_prio_his = option_priority;
322 }
323 return 1;
324 }
325
326 option_error("invalid parameter '%s' for ipx-node option", *argv);
327 return 0;
328}
329
330static void
331printipxnode(opt, printer, arg)
332 option_t *opt;
333 void (*printer) __P((void *, char *, ...));
334 void *arg;
335{
336 unsigned char *p;
337
338 p = ipxcp_wantoptions[0].our_node;
339 if (ipx_prio_our)
340 printer(arg, "%.2x%.2x%.2x%.2x%.2x%.2x",
341 p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3], p[4], p[5]);
342 printer(arg, ":");
343 p = ipxcp_wantoptions[0].his_node;
344 if (ipx_prio_his)
345 printer(arg, "%.2x%.2x%.2x%.2x%.2x%.2x",
346 p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3], p[4], p[5]);
347}
348
349static int
350setipxname (argv)
351 char **argv;
352{
353 u_char *dest = ipxcp_wantoptions[0].name;
354 char *src = *argv;
355 int count;
356 char ch;
357
358 ipxcp_wantoptions[0].neg_name = 1;
359 ipxcp_allowoptions[0].neg_name = 1;
360 memset (dest, '\0', sizeof (ipxcp_wantoptions[0].name));
361
362 count = 0;
363 while (*src) {
364 ch = *src++;
365 if (! isalnum (ch) && ch != '_') {
366 option_error("IPX router name must be alphanumeric or _");
367 return 0;
368 }
369
370 if (count >= sizeof (ipxcp_wantoptions[0].name) - 1) {
371 option_error("IPX router name is limited to %d characters",
372 sizeof (ipxcp_wantoptions[0].name) - 1);
373 return 0;
374 }
375
376 dest[count++] = toupper (ch);
377 }
378 dest[count] = 0;
379
380 return 1;
381}
382
383/*
384 * ipxcp_init - Initialize IPXCP.
385 */
386static void
387ipxcp_init(unit)
388 int unit;
389{
390 fsm *f = &ipxcp_fsm[unit];
391
392 f->unit = unit;
393 f->protocol = PPP_IPXCP;
394 f->callbacks = &ipxcp_callbacks;
395 fsm_init(&ipxcp_fsm[unit]);
396
397 memset (wo->name, 0, sizeof (wo->name));
398 memset (wo->our_node, 0, sizeof (wo->our_node));
399 memset (wo->his_node, 0, sizeof (wo->his_node));
400
401 wo->neg_nn = 1;
402 wo->neg_complete = 1;
403 wo->network = 0;
404
405 ao->neg_node = 1;
406 ao->neg_nn = 1;
407 ao->neg_name = 1;
408 ao->neg_complete = 1;
409 ao->neg_router = 1;
410
411 ao->accept_local = 0;
412 ao->accept_remote = 0;
413 ao->accept_network = 0;
414
415 wo->tried_rip = 0;
416 wo->tried_nlsp = 0;
417}
418
419/*
420 * Copy the node number
421 */
422
423static void
424copy_node (src, dst)
425u_char *src, *dst;
426{
427 memcpy (dst, src, sizeof (ipxcp_wantoptions[0].our_node));
428}
429
430/*
431 * Compare node numbers
432 */
433
434static int
435compare_node (src, dst)
436u_char *src, *dst;
437{
438 return memcmp (dst, src, sizeof (ipxcp_wantoptions[0].our_node)) == 0;
439}
440
441/*
442 * Is the node number zero?
443 */
444
445static int
446zero_node (node)
447u_char *node;
448{
449 int indx;
450 for (indx = 0; indx < sizeof (ipxcp_wantoptions[0].our_node); ++indx)
451 if (node [indx] != 0)
452 return 0;
453 return 1;
454}
455
456/*
457 * Increment the node number
458 */
459
460static void
461inc_node (node)
462u_char *node;
463{
464 u_char *outp;
465 u_int32_t magic_num;
466
467 outp = node;
468 magic_num = magic();
469 *outp++ = '\0';
470 *outp++ = '\0';
471 PUTLONG (magic_num, outp);
472}
473
474/*
475 * ipxcp_open - IPXCP is allowed to come up.
476 */
477static void
478ipxcp_open(unit)
479 int unit;
480{
481 fsm_open(&ipxcp_fsm[unit]);
482}
483
484/*
485 * ipxcp_close - Take IPXCP down.
486 */
487static void
488ipxcp_close(unit, reason)
489 int unit;
490 char *reason;
491{
492 fsm_close(&ipxcp_fsm[unit], reason);
493}
494
495
496/*
497 * ipxcp_lowerup - The lower layer is up.
498 */
499static void
500ipxcp_lowerup(unit)
501 int unit;
502{
503 fsm_lowerup(&ipxcp_fsm[unit]);
504}
505
506
507/*
508 * ipxcp_lowerdown - The lower layer is down.
509 */
510static void
511ipxcp_lowerdown(unit)
512 int unit;
513{
514 fsm_lowerdown(&ipxcp_fsm[unit]);
515}
516
517
518/*
519 * ipxcp_input - Input IPXCP packet.
520 */
521static void
522ipxcp_input(unit, p, len)
523 int unit;
524 u_char *p;
525 int len;
526{
527 fsm_input(&ipxcp_fsm[unit], p, len);
528}
529
530
531/*
532 * ipxcp_protrej - A Protocol-Reject was received for IPXCP.
533 *
534 * Pretend the lower layer went down, so we shut up.
535 */
536static void
537ipxcp_protrej(unit)
538 int unit;
539{
540 fsm_lowerdown(&ipxcp_fsm[unit]);
541}
542
543
544/*
545 * ipxcp_resetci - Reset our CI.
546 */
547static void
548ipxcp_resetci(f)
549 fsm *f;
550{
551 wo->req_node = wo->neg_node && ao->neg_node;
552 wo->req_nn = wo->neg_nn && ao->neg_nn;
553
554 if (wo->our_network == 0) {
555 wo->neg_node = 1;
556 ao->accept_network = 1;
557 }
558/*
559 * If our node number is zero then change it.
560 */
561 if (zero_node (wo->our_node)) {
562 inc_node (wo->our_node);
563 ao->accept_local = 1;
564 wo->neg_node = 1;
565 }
566/*
567 * If his node number is zero then change it.
568 */
569 if (zero_node (wo->his_node)) {
570 inc_node (wo->his_node);
571 ao->accept_remote = 1;
572 }
573/*
574 * If no routing agent was specified then we do RIP/SAP according to the
575 * RFC documents. If you have specified something then OK. Otherwise, we
576 * do RIP/SAP.
577 */
578 if (ao->router == 0) {
579 ao->router |= BIT(RIP_SAP);
580 wo->router |= BIT(RIP_SAP);
581 }
582
583 /* Always specify a routing protocol unless it was REJected. */
584 wo->neg_router = 1;
585/*
586 * Start with these default values
587 */
588 *go = *wo;
589}
590
591/*
592 * ipxcp_cilen - Return length of our CI.
593 */
594
595static int
596ipxcp_cilen(f)
597 fsm *f;
598{
599 int len;
600
601 len = go->neg_nn ? CILEN_NETN : 0;
602 len += go->neg_node ? CILEN_NODEN : 0;
603 len += go->neg_name ? CILEN_NAME + strlen ((char *)go->name) - 1 : 0;
604
605 /* RFC says that defaults should not be included. */
606 if (go->neg_router && to_external(go->router) != RIP_SAP)
607 len += CILEN_PROTOCOL;
608
609 return (len);
610}
611
612
613/*
614 * ipxcp_addci - Add our desired CIs to a packet.
615 */
616static void
617ipxcp_addci(f, ucp, lenp)
618 fsm *f;
619 u_char *ucp;
620 int *lenp;
621{
622/*
623 * Add the options to the record.
624 */
625 if (go->neg_nn) {
626 PUTCHAR (IPX_NETWORK_NUMBER, ucp);
627 PUTCHAR (CILEN_NETN, ucp);
628 PUTLONG (go->our_network, ucp);
629 }
630
631 if (go->neg_node) {
632 int indx;
633 PUTCHAR (IPX_NODE_NUMBER, ucp);
634 PUTCHAR (CILEN_NODEN, ucp);
635 for (indx = 0; indx < sizeof (go->our_node); ++indx)
636 PUTCHAR (go->our_node[indx], ucp);
637 }
638
639 if (go->neg_name) {
640 int cilen = strlen ((char *)go->name);
641 int indx;
642 PUTCHAR (IPX_ROUTER_NAME, ucp);
643 PUTCHAR (CILEN_NAME + cilen - 1, ucp);
644 for (indx = 0; indx < cilen; ++indx)
645 PUTCHAR (go->name [indx], ucp);
646 }
647
648 if (go->neg_router) {
649 short external = to_external (go->router);
650 if (external != RIP_SAP) {
651 PUTCHAR (IPX_ROUTER_PROTOCOL, ucp);
652 PUTCHAR (CILEN_PROTOCOL, ucp);
653 PUTSHORT (external, ucp);
654 }
655 }
656}
657
658/*
659 * ipxcp_ackci - Ack our CIs.
660 *
661 * Returns:
662 * 0 - Ack was bad.
663 * 1 - Ack was good.
664 */
665static int
666ipxcp_ackci(f, p, len)
667 fsm *f;
668 u_char *p;
669 int len;
670{
671 u_short cilen, citype, cishort;
672 u_char cichar;
673 u_int32_t cilong;
674
675#define ACKCIVOID(opt, neg) \
676 if (neg) { \
677 if ((len -= CILEN_VOID) < 0) \
678 break; \
679 GETCHAR(citype, p); \
680 GETCHAR(cilen, p); \
681 if (cilen != CILEN_VOID || \
682 citype != opt) \
683 break; \
684 }
685
686#define ACKCICOMPLETE(opt,neg) ACKCIVOID(opt, neg)
687
688#define ACKCICHARS(opt, neg, val, cnt) \
689 if (neg) { \
690 int indx, count = cnt; \
691 len -= (count + 2); \
692 if (len < 0) \
693 break; \
694 GETCHAR(citype, p); \
695 GETCHAR(cilen, p); \
696 if (cilen != (count + 2) || \
697 citype != opt) \
698 break; \
699 for (indx = 0; indx < count; ++indx) {\
700 GETCHAR(cichar, p); \
701 if (cichar != ((u_char *) &val)[indx]) \
702 break; \
703 }\
704 if (indx != count) \
705 break; \
706 }
707
708#define ACKCINODE(opt,neg,val) ACKCICHARS(opt,neg,val,sizeof(val))
709#define ACKCINAME(opt,neg,val) ACKCICHARS(opt,neg,val,strlen((char *)val))
710
711#define ACKCINETWORK(opt, neg, val) \
712 if (neg) { \
713 if ((len -= CILEN_NETN) < 0) \
714 break; \
715 GETCHAR(citype, p); \
716 GETCHAR(cilen, p); \
717 if (cilen != CILEN_NETN || \
718 citype != opt) \
719 break; \
720 GETLONG(cilong, p); \
721 if (cilong != val) \
722 break; \
723 }
724
725#define ACKCIPROTO(opt, neg, val) \
726 if (neg) { \
727 if (len < 2) \
728 break; \
729 GETCHAR(citype, p); \
730 GETCHAR(cilen, p); \
731 if (cilen != CILEN_PROTOCOL || citype != opt) \
732 break; \
733 len -= cilen; \
734 if (len < 0) \
735 break; \
736 GETSHORT(cishort, p); \
737 if (cishort != to_external (val) || cishort == RIP_SAP) \
738 break; \
739 }
740/*
741 * Process the ACK frame in the order in which the frame was assembled
742 */
743 do {
744 ACKCINETWORK (IPX_NETWORK_NUMBER, go->neg_nn, go->our_network);
745 ACKCINODE (IPX_NODE_NUMBER, go->neg_node, go->our_node);
746 ACKCINAME (IPX_ROUTER_NAME, go->neg_name, go->name);
747 if (len > 0)
748 ACKCIPROTO (IPX_ROUTER_PROTOCOL, go->neg_router, go->router);
749/*
750 * This is the end of the record.
751 */
752 if (len == 0)
753 return (1);
754 } while (0);
755/*
756 * The frame is invalid
757 */
758 IPXCPDEBUG(("ipxcp_ackci: received bad Ack!"));
759 return (0);
760}
761
762/*
763 * ipxcp_nakci - Peer has sent a NAK for some of our CIs.
764 * This should not modify any state if the Nak is bad
765 * or if IPXCP is in the OPENED state.
766 *
767 * Returns:
768 * 0 - Nak was bad.
769 * 1 - Nak was good.
770 */
771
772static int
773ipxcp_nakci(f, p, len, treat_as_reject)
774 fsm *f;
775 u_char *p;
776 int len;
777 int treat_as_reject;
778{
779 u_char citype, cilen, *next;
780 u_short s;
781 u_int32_t l;
782 ipxcp_options no; /* options we've seen Naks for */
783 ipxcp_options try; /* options to request next time */
784
785 BZERO(&no, sizeof(no));
786 try = *go;
787
788 while (len >= CILEN_VOID) {
789 GETCHAR (citype, p);
790 GETCHAR (cilen, p);
791 len -= cilen;
792 if (cilen < CILEN_VOID || len < 0)
793 goto bad;
794 next = &p [cilen - CILEN_VOID];
795
796 switch (citype) {
797 case IPX_NETWORK_NUMBER:
798 if (!go->neg_nn || no.neg_nn || (cilen != CILEN_NETN))
799 goto bad;
800 no.neg_nn = 1;
801
802 GETLONG(l, p);
803 if (treat_as_reject)
804 try.neg_nn = 0;
805 else if (l && ao->accept_network)
806 try.our_network = l;
807 break;
808
809 case IPX_NODE_NUMBER:
810 if (!go->neg_node || no.neg_node || (cilen != CILEN_NODEN))
811 goto bad;
812 no.neg_node = 1;
813
814 if (treat_as_reject)
815 try.neg_node = 0;
816 else if (!zero_node (p) && ao->accept_local &&
817 ! compare_node (p, ho->his_node))
818 copy_node (p, try.our_node);
819 break;
820
821 /* This has never been sent. Ignore the NAK frame */
822 case IPX_COMPRESSION_PROTOCOL:
823 goto bad;
824
825 case IPX_ROUTER_PROTOCOL:
826 if (!go->neg_router || (cilen < CILEN_PROTOCOL))
827 goto bad;
828
829 GETSHORT (s, p);
830 if (s > 15) /* This is just bad, but ignore for now. */
831 break;
832
833 s = BIT(s);
834 if (no.router & s) /* duplicate NAKs are always bad */
835 goto bad;
836
837 if (no.router == 0) /* Reset on first NAK only */
838 try.router = 0;
839
840 no.router |= s;
841 try.router |= s;
842 try.neg_router = 1;
843 break;
844
845 /* These, according to the RFC, must never be NAKed. */
846 case IPX_ROUTER_NAME:
847 case IPX_COMPLETE:
848 goto bad;
849
850 /* These are for options which we have not seen. */
851 default:
852 break;
853 }
854 p = next;
855 }
856
857 /*
858 * Do not permit the peer to force a router protocol which we do not
859 * support. However, default to the condition that will accept "NONE".
860 */
861 try.router &= (ao->router | BIT(IPX_NONE));
862 if (try.router == 0 && ao->router != 0)
863 try.router = BIT(IPX_NONE);
864
865 if (try.router != 0)
866 try.neg_router = 1;
867
868 /*
869 * OK, the Nak is good. Now we can update state.
870 * If there are any options left, we ignore them.
871 */
872 if (f->state != OPENED)
873 *go = try;
874
875 return 1;
876
877bad:
878 IPXCPDEBUG(("ipxcp_nakci: received bad Nak!"));
879 return 0;
880}
881
882/*
883 * ipxcp_rejci - Reject some of our CIs.
884 */
885static int
886ipxcp_rejci(f, p, len)
887 fsm *f;
888 u_char *p;
889 int len;
890{
891 u_short cilen, citype, cishort;
892 u_char cichar;
893 u_int32_t cilong;
894 ipxcp_options try; /* options to request next time */
895
896#define REJCINETWORK(opt, neg, val) \
897 if (neg && p[0] == opt) { \
898 if ((len -= CILEN_NETN) < 0) \
899 break; \
900 GETCHAR(citype, p); \
901 GETCHAR(cilen, p); \
902 if (cilen != CILEN_NETN || \
903 citype != opt) \
904 break; \
905 GETLONG(cilong, p); \
906 if (cilong != val) \
907 break; \
908 neg = 0; \
909 }
910
911#define REJCICHARS(opt, neg, val, cnt) \
912 if (neg && p[0] == opt) { \
913 int indx, count = cnt; \
914 len -= (count + 2); \
915 if (len < 0) \
916 break; \
917 GETCHAR(citype, p); \
918 GETCHAR(cilen, p); \
919 if (cilen != (count + 2) || \
920 citype != opt) \
921 break; \
922 for (indx = 0; indx < count; ++indx) {\
923 GETCHAR(cichar, p); \
924 if (cichar != ((u_char *) &val)[indx]) \
925 break; \
926 }\
927 if (indx != count) \
928 break; \
929 neg = 0; \
930 }
931
932#define REJCINODE(opt,neg,val) REJCICHARS(opt,neg,val,sizeof(val))
933#define REJCINAME(opt,neg,val) REJCICHARS(opt,neg,val,strlen((char *)val))
934
935#define REJCIVOID(opt, neg) \
936 if (neg && p[0] == opt) { \
937 if ((len -= CILEN_VOID) < 0) \
938 break; \
939 GETCHAR(citype, p); \
940 GETCHAR(cilen, p); \
941 if (cilen != CILEN_VOID || citype != opt) \
942 break; \
943 neg = 0; \
944 }
945
946/* a reject for RIP/SAP is invalid since we don't send it and you can't
947 reject something which is not sent. (You can NAK, but you can't REJ.) */
948#define REJCIPROTO(opt, neg, val, bit) \
949 if (neg && p[0] == opt) { \
950 if ((len -= CILEN_PROTOCOL) < 0) \
951 break; \
952 GETCHAR(citype, p); \
953 GETCHAR(cilen, p); \
954 if (cilen != CILEN_PROTOCOL) \
955 break; \
956 GETSHORT(cishort, p); \
957 if (cishort != to_external (val) || cishort == RIP_SAP) \
958 break; \
959 neg = 0; \
960 }
961/*
962 * Any Rejected CIs must be in exactly the same order that we sent.
963 * Check packet length and CI length at each step.
964 * If we find any deviations, then this packet is bad.
965 */
966 try = *go;
967
968 do {
969 REJCINETWORK (IPX_NETWORK_NUMBER, try.neg_nn, try.our_network);
970 REJCINODE (IPX_NODE_NUMBER, try.neg_node, try.our_node);
971 REJCINAME (IPX_ROUTER_NAME, try.neg_name, try.name);
972 REJCIPROTO (IPX_ROUTER_PROTOCOL, try.neg_router, try.router, 0);
973/*
974 * This is the end of the record.
975 */
976 if (len == 0) {
977 if (f->state != OPENED)
978 *go = try;
979 return (1);
980 }
981 } while (0);
982/*
983 * The frame is invalid at this point.
984 */
985 IPXCPDEBUG(("ipxcp_rejci: received bad Reject!"));
986 return 0;
987}
988
989/*
990 * ipxcp_reqci - Check the peer's requested CIs and send appropriate response.
991 *
992 * Returns: CONFACK, CONFNAK or CONFREJ and input packet modified
993 * appropriately. If reject_if_disagree is non-zero, doesn't return
994 * CONFNAK; returns CONFREJ if it can't return CONFACK.
995 */
996static int
997ipxcp_reqci(f, inp, len, reject_if_disagree)
998 fsm *f;
999 u_char *inp; /* Requested CIs */
1000 int *len; /* Length of requested CIs */
1001 int reject_if_disagree;
1002{
1003 u_char *cip, *next; /* Pointer to current and next CIs */
1004 u_short cilen, citype; /* Parsed len, type */
1005 u_short cishort; /* Parsed short value */
1006 u_int32_t cinetwork; /* Parsed address values */
1007 int rc = CONFACK; /* Final packet return code */
1008 int orc; /* Individual option return code */
1009 u_char *p; /* Pointer to next char to parse */
1010 u_char *ucp = inp; /* Pointer to current output char */
1011 int l = *len; /* Length left */
1012
1013 /*
1014 * Reset all his options.
1015 */
1016 BZERO(ho, sizeof(*ho));
1017
1018 /*
1019 * Process all his options.
1020 */
1021 next = inp;
1022 while (l) {
1023 orc = CONFACK; /* Assume success */
1024 cip = p = next; /* Remember begining of CI */
1025 if (l < 2 || /* Not enough data for CI header or */
1026 p[1] < 2 || /* CI length too small or */
1027 p[1] > l) { /* CI length too big? */
1028 IPXCPDEBUG(("ipxcp_reqci: bad CI length!"));
1029 orc = CONFREJ; /* Reject bad CI */
1030 cilen = l; /* Reject till end of packet */
1031 l = 0; /* Don't loop again */
1032 goto endswitch;
1033 }
1034 GETCHAR(citype, p); /* Parse CI type */
1035 GETCHAR(cilen, p); /* Parse CI length */
1036 l -= cilen; /* Adjust remaining length */
1037 next += cilen; /* Step to next CI */
1038
1039 switch (citype) { /* Check CI type */
1040/*
1041 * The network number must match. Choose the larger of the two.
1042 */
1043 case IPX_NETWORK_NUMBER:
1044 /* if we wont negotiate the network number or the length is wrong
1045 then reject the option */
1046 if ( !ao->neg_nn || cilen != CILEN_NETN ) {
1047 orc = CONFREJ;
1048 break;
1049 }
1050 GETLONG(cinetwork, p);
1051
1052 /* If the network numbers match then acknowledge them. */
1053 if (cinetwork != 0) {
1054 ho->his_network = cinetwork;
1055 ho->neg_nn = 1;
1056 if (wo->our_network == cinetwork)
1057 break;
1058/*
1059 * If the network number is not given or we don't accept their change or
1060 * the network number is too small then NAK it.
1061 */
1062 if (! ao->accept_network || cinetwork < wo->our_network) {
1063 DECPTR (sizeof (u_int32_t), p);
1064 PUTLONG (wo->our_network, p);
1065 orc = CONFNAK;
1066 }
1067 break;
1068 }
1069/*
1070 * The peer sent '0' for the network. Give it ours if we have one.
1071 */
1072 if (go->our_network != 0) {
1073 DECPTR (sizeof (u_int32_t), p);
1074 PUTLONG (wo->our_network, p);
1075 orc = CONFNAK;
1076/*
1077 * We don't have one. Reject the value.
1078 */
1079 } else
1080 orc = CONFREJ;
1081
1082 break;
1083/*
1084 * The node number is required
1085 */
1086 case IPX_NODE_NUMBER:
1087 /* if we wont negotiate the node number or the length is wrong
1088 then reject the option */
1089 if ( cilen != CILEN_NODEN ) {
1090 orc = CONFREJ;
1091 break;
1092 }
1093
1094 copy_node (p, ho->his_node);
1095 ho->neg_node = 1;
1096/*
1097 * If the remote does not have a number and we do then NAK it with the value
1098 * which we have for it. (We never have a default value of zero.)
1099 */
1100 if (zero_node (ho->his_node)) {
1101 orc = CONFNAK;
1102 copy_node (wo->his_node, p);
1103 INCPTR (sizeof (wo->his_node), p);
1104 break;
1105 }
1106/*
1107 * If you have given me the expected network node number then I'll accept
1108 * it now.
1109 */
1110 if (compare_node (wo->his_node, ho->his_node)) {
1111 orc = CONFACK;
1112 ho->neg_node = 1;
1113 INCPTR (sizeof (wo->his_node), p);
1114 break;
1115 }
1116/*
1117 * If his node number is the same as ours then ask him to try the next
1118 * value.
1119 */
1120 if (compare_node (ho->his_node, go->our_node)) {
1121 inc_node (ho->his_node);
1122 orc = CONFNAK;
1123 copy_node (ho->his_node, p);
1124 INCPTR (sizeof (wo->his_node), p);
1125 break;
1126 }
1127/*
1128 * If we don't accept a new value then NAK it.
1129 */
1130 if (! ao->accept_remote) {
1131 copy_node (wo->his_node, p);
1132 INCPTR (sizeof (wo->his_node), p);
1133 orc = CONFNAK;
1134 break;
1135 }
1136 orc = CONFACK;
1137 ho->neg_node = 1;
1138 INCPTR (sizeof (wo->his_node), p);
1139 break;
1140/*
1141 * Compression is not desired at this time. It is always rejected.
1142 */
1143 case IPX_COMPRESSION_PROTOCOL:
1144 orc = CONFREJ;
1145 break;
1146/*
1147 * The routing protocol is a bitmask of various types. Any combination
1148 * of the values RIP_SAP and NLSP are permissible. 'IPX_NONE' for no
1149 * routing protocol must be specified only once.
1150 */
1151 case IPX_ROUTER_PROTOCOL:
1152 if ( !ao->neg_router || cilen < CILEN_PROTOCOL ) {
1153 orc = CONFREJ;
1154 break;
1155 }
1156
1157 GETSHORT (cishort, p);
1158
1159 if (wo->neg_router == 0) {
1160 wo->neg_router = 1;
1161 wo->router = BIT(IPX_NONE);
1162 }
1163
1164 if ((cishort == IPX_NONE && ho->router != 0) ||
1165 (ho->router & BIT(IPX_NONE))) {
1166 orc = CONFREJ;
1167 break;
1168 }
1169
1170 cishort = BIT(cishort);
1171 if (ho->router & cishort) {
1172 orc = CONFREJ;
1173 break;
1174 }
1175
1176 ho->router |= cishort;
1177 ho->neg_router = 1;
1178
1179 /* Finally do not allow a router protocol which we do not
1180 support. */
1181
1182 if ((cishort & (ao->router | BIT(IPX_NONE))) == 0) {
1183 int protocol;
1184
1185 if (cishort == BIT(NLSP) &&
1186 (ao->router & BIT(RIP_SAP)) &&
1187 !wo->tried_rip) {
1188 protocol = RIP_SAP;
1189 wo->tried_rip = 1;
1190 } else
1191 protocol = IPX_NONE;
1192
1193 DECPTR (sizeof (u_int16_t), p);
1194 PUTSHORT (protocol, p);
1195 orc = CONFNAK;
1196 }
1197 break;
1198/*
1199 * The router name is advisorary. Just accept it if it is not too large.
1200 */
1201 case IPX_ROUTER_NAME:
1202 if (cilen >= CILEN_NAME) {
1203 int name_size = cilen - CILEN_NAME;
1204 if (name_size > sizeof (ho->name))
1205 name_size = sizeof (ho->name) - 1;
1206 memset (ho->name, 0, sizeof (ho->name));
1207 memcpy (ho->name, p, name_size);
1208 ho->name [name_size] = '\0';
1209 ho->neg_name = 1;
1210 orc = CONFACK;
1211 break;
1212 }
1213 orc = CONFREJ;
1214 break;
1215/*
1216 * This is advisorary.
1217 */
1218 case IPX_COMPLETE:
1219 if (cilen != CILEN_COMPLETE)
1220 orc = CONFREJ;
1221 else {
1222 ho->neg_complete = 1;
1223 orc = CONFACK;
1224 }
1225 break;
1226/*
1227 * All other entries are not known at this time.
1228 */
1229 default:
1230 orc = CONFREJ;
1231 break;
1232 }
1233endswitch:
1234 if (orc == CONFACK && /* Good CI */
1235 rc != CONFACK) /* but prior CI wasnt? */
1236 continue; /* Don't send this one */
1237
1238 if (orc == CONFNAK) { /* Nak this CI? */
1239 if (reject_if_disagree) /* Getting fed up with sending NAKs? */
1240 orc = CONFREJ; /* Get tough if so */
1241 if (rc == CONFREJ) /* Rejecting prior CI? */
1242 continue; /* Don't send this one */
1243 if (rc == CONFACK) { /* Ack'd all prior CIs? */
1244 rc = CONFNAK; /* Not anymore... */
1245 ucp = inp; /* Backup */
1246 }
1247 }
1248
1249 if (orc == CONFREJ && /* Reject this CI */
1250 rc != CONFREJ) { /* but no prior ones? */
1251 rc = CONFREJ;
1252 ucp = inp; /* Backup */
1253 }
1254
1255 /* Need to move CI? */
1256 if (ucp != cip)
1257 BCOPY(cip, ucp, cilen); /* Move it */
1258
1259 /* Update output pointer */
1260 INCPTR(cilen, ucp);
1261 }
1262
1263 /*
1264 * If we aren't rejecting this packet, and we want to negotiate
1265 * their address, and they didn't send their address, then we
1266 * send a NAK with a IPX_NODE_NUMBER option appended. We assume the
1267 * input buffer is long enough that we can append the extra
1268 * option safely.
1269 */
1270
1271 if (rc != CONFREJ && !ho->neg_node &&
1272 wo->req_nn && !reject_if_disagree) {
1273 if (rc == CONFACK) {
1274 rc = CONFNAK;
1275 wo->req_nn = 0; /* don't ask again */
1276 ucp = inp; /* reset pointer */
1277 }
1278
1279 if (zero_node (wo->his_node))
1280 inc_node (wo->his_node);
1281
1282 PUTCHAR (IPX_NODE_NUMBER, ucp);
1283 PUTCHAR (CILEN_NODEN, ucp);
1284 copy_node (wo->his_node, ucp);
1285 INCPTR (sizeof (wo->his_node), ucp);
1286 }
1287
1288 *len = ucp - inp; /* Compute output length */
1289 IPXCPDEBUG(("ipxcp: returning Configure-%s", CODENAME(rc)));
1290 return (rc); /* Return final code */
1291}
1292
1293/*
1294 * ipxcp_up - IPXCP has come UP.
1295 *
1296 * Configure the IP network interface appropriately and bring it up.
1297 */
1298
1299static void
1300ipxcp_up(f)
1301 fsm *f;
1302{
1303 int unit = f->unit;
1304
1305 IPXCPDEBUG(("ipxcp: up"));
1306
1307 /* The default router protocol is RIP/SAP. */
1308 if (ho->router == 0)
1309 ho->router = BIT(RIP_SAP);
1310
1311 if (go->router == 0)
1312 go->router = BIT(RIP_SAP);
1313
1314 /* Fetch the network number */
1315 if (!ho->neg_nn)
1316 ho->his_network = wo->his_network;
1317
1318 if (!ho->neg_node)
1319 copy_node (wo->his_node, ho->his_node);
1320
1321 if (!wo->neg_node && !go->neg_node)
1322 copy_node (wo->our_node, go->our_node);
1323
1324 if (zero_node (go->our_node)) {
1325 static char errmsg[] = "Could not determine local IPX node address";
1326 if (debug)
1327 error(errmsg);
1328 ipxcp_close(f->unit, errmsg);
1329 return;
1330 }
1331
1332 go->network = go->our_network;
1333 if (ho->his_network != 0 && ho->his_network > go->network)
1334 go->network = ho->his_network;
1335
1336 if (go->network == 0) {
1337 static char errmsg[] = "Can not determine network number";
1338 if (debug)
1339 error(errmsg);
1340 ipxcp_close (unit, errmsg);
1341 return;
1342 }
1343
1344 /* bring the interface up */
1345 if (!sifup(unit)) {
1346 if (debug)
1347 warn("sifup failed (IPX)");
1348 ipxcp_close(unit, "Interface configuration failed");
1349 return;
1350 }
1351 ipxcp_is_up = 1;
1352
1353 /* set the network number for IPX */
1354 if (!sipxfaddr(unit, go->network, go->our_node)) {
1355 if (debug)
1356 warn("sipxfaddr failed");
1357 ipxcp_close(unit, "Interface configuration failed");
1358 return;
1359 }
1360
1361 np_up(f->unit, PPP_IPX);
1362
1363 /*
1364 * Execute the ipx-up script, like this:
1365 * /etc/ppp/ipx-up interface tty speed local-IPX remote-IPX
1366 */
1367
1368 ipxcp_script (f, _PATH_IPXUP);
1369}
1370
1371/*
1372 * ipxcp_down - IPXCP has gone DOWN.
1373 *
1374 * Take the IP network interface down, clear its addresses
1375 * and delete routes through it.
1376 */
1377
1378static void
1379ipxcp_down(f)
1380 fsm *f;
1381{
1382 IPXCPDEBUG(("ipxcp: down"));
1383
1384 if (!ipxcp_is_up)
1385 return;
1386 ipxcp_is_up = 0;
1387 np_down(f->unit, PPP_IPX);
1388 cipxfaddr(f->unit);
1389 sifnpmode(f->unit, PPP_IPX, NPMODE_DROP);
1390 sifdown(f->unit);
1391 ipxcp_script (f, _PATH_IPXDOWN);
1392}
1393
1394
1395/*
1396 * ipxcp_finished - possibly shut down the lower layers.
1397 */
1398static void
1399ipxcp_finished(f)
1400 fsm *f;
1401{
1402 np_finished(f->unit, PPP_IPX);
1403}
1404
1405
1406/*
1407 * ipxcp_script - Execute a script with arguments
1408 * interface-name tty-name speed local-IPX remote-IPX networks.
1409 */
1410static void
1411ipxcp_script(f, script)
1412 fsm *f;
1413 char *script;
1414{
1415 char strspeed[32], strlocal[32], strremote[32];
1416 char strnetwork[32], strpid[32];
1417 char *argv[14], strproto_lcl[32], strproto_rmt[32];
1418
1419 slprintf(strpid, sizeof(strpid), "%d", getpid());
1420 slprintf(strspeed, sizeof(strspeed),"%d", baud_rate);
1421
1422 strproto_lcl[0] = '\0';
1423 if (go->neg_router && ((go->router & BIT(IPX_NONE)) == 0)) {
1424 if (go->router & BIT(RIP_SAP))
1425 strlcpy (strproto_lcl, "RIP ", sizeof(strproto_lcl));
1426 if (go->router & BIT(NLSP))
1427 strlcat (strproto_lcl, "NLSP ", sizeof(strproto_lcl));
1428 }
1429
1430 if (strproto_lcl[0] == '\0')
1431 strlcpy (strproto_lcl, "NONE ", sizeof(strproto_lcl));
1432
1433 strproto_lcl[strlen (strproto_lcl)-1] = '\0';
1434
1435 strproto_rmt[0] = '\0';
1436 if (ho->neg_router && ((ho->router & BIT(IPX_NONE)) == 0)) {
1437 if (ho->router & BIT(RIP_SAP))
1438 strlcpy (strproto_rmt, "RIP ", sizeof(strproto_rmt));
1439 if (ho->router & BIT(NLSP))
1440 strlcat (strproto_rmt, "NLSP ", sizeof(strproto_rmt));
1441 }
1442
1443 if (strproto_rmt[0] == '\0')
1444 strlcpy (strproto_rmt, "NONE ", sizeof(strproto_rmt));
1445
1446 strproto_rmt[strlen (strproto_rmt)-1] = '\0';
1447
1448 strlcpy (strnetwork, ipx_ntoa (go->network), sizeof(strnetwork));
1449
1450 slprintf (strlocal, sizeof(strlocal), "%0.6B", go->our_node);
1451
1452 slprintf (strremote, sizeof(strremote), "%0.6B", ho->his_node);
1453
1454 argv[0] = script;
1455 argv[1] = ifname;
1456 argv[2] = devnam;
1457 argv[3] = strspeed;
1458 argv[4] = strnetwork;
1459 argv[5] = strlocal;
1460 argv[6] = strremote;
1461 argv[7] = strproto_lcl;
1462 argv[8] = strproto_rmt;
1463 argv[9] = (char *)go->name;
1464 argv[10] = (char *)ho->name;
1465 argv[11] = ipparam;
1466 argv[12] = strpid;
1467 argv[13] = NULL;
1468 run_program(script, argv, 0, NULL, NULL, 0);
1469}
1470
1471/*
1472 * ipxcp_printpkt - print the contents of an IPXCP packet.
1473 */
1474static char *ipxcp_codenames[] = {
1475 "ConfReq", "ConfAck", "ConfNak", "ConfRej",
1476 "TermReq", "TermAck", "CodeRej"
1477};
1478
1479static int
1480ipxcp_printpkt(p, plen, printer, arg)
1481 u_char *p;
1482 int plen;
1483 void (*printer) __P((void *, char *, ...));
1484 void *arg;
1485{
1486 int code, id, len, olen;
1487 u_char *pstart, *optend;
1488 u_short cishort;
1489 u_int32_t cilong;
1490
1491 if (plen < HEADERLEN)
1492 return 0;
1493 pstart = p;
1494 GETCHAR(code, p);
1495 GETCHAR(id, p);
1496 GETSHORT(len, p);
1497 if (len < HEADERLEN || len > plen)
1498 return 0;
1499
1500 if (code >= 1 && code <= sizeof(ipxcp_codenames) / sizeof(char *))
1501 printer(arg, " %s", ipxcp_codenames[code-1]);
1502 else
1503 printer(arg, " code=0x%x", code);
1504 printer(arg, " id=0x%x", id);
1505 len -= HEADERLEN;
1506 switch (code) {
1507 case CONFREQ:
1508 case CONFACK:
1509 case CONFNAK:
1510 case CONFREJ:
1511 /* print option list */
1512 while (len >= 2) {
1513 GETCHAR(code, p);
1514 GETCHAR(olen, p);
1515 p -= 2;
1516 if (olen < CILEN_VOID || olen > len) {
1517 break;
1518 }
1519 printer(arg, " <");
1520 len -= olen;
1521 optend = p + olen;
1522 switch (code) {
1523 case IPX_NETWORK_NUMBER:
1524 if (olen == CILEN_NETN) {
1525 p += 2;
1526 GETLONG(cilong, p);
1527 printer (arg, "network %s", ipx_ntoa (cilong));
1528 }
1529 break;
1530 case IPX_NODE_NUMBER:
1531 if (olen == CILEN_NODEN) {
1532 p += 2;
1533 printer (arg, "node ");
1534 while (p < optend) {
1535 GETCHAR(code, p);
1536 printer(arg, "%.2x", (int) (unsigned int) (unsigned char) code);
1537 }
1538 }
1539 break;
1540 case IPX_COMPRESSION_PROTOCOL:
1541 if (olen == CILEN_COMPRESS) {
1542 p += 2;
1543 GETSHORT (cishort, p);
1544 printer (arg, "compression %d", (int) cishort);
1545 }
1546 break;
1547 case IPX_ROUTER_PROTOCOL:
1548 if (olen == CILEN_PROTOCOL) {
1549 p += 2;
1550 GETSHORT (cishort, p);
1551 printer (arg, "router proto %d", (int) cishort);
1552 }
1553 break;
1554 case IPX_ROUTER_NAME:
1555 if (olen >= CILEN_NAME) {
1556 p += 2;
1557 printer (arg, "router name \"");
1558 while (p < optend) {
1559 GETCHAR(code, p);
1560 if (code >= 0x20 && code <= 0x7E)
1561 printer (arg, "%c", (int) (unsigned int) (unsigned char) code);
1562 else
1563 printer (arg, " \\%.2x", (int) (unsigned int) (unsigned char) code);
1564 }
1565 printer (arg, "\"");
1566 }
1567 break;
1568 case IPX_COMPLETE:
1569 if (olen == CILEN_COMPLETE) {
1570 p += 2;
1571 printer (arg, "complete");
1572 }
1573 break;
1574 default:
1575 break;
1576 }
1577
1578 while (p < optend) {
1579 GETCHAR(code, p);
1580 printer(arg, " %.2x", (int) (unsigned int) (unsigned char) code);
1581 }
1582 printer(arg, ">");
1583 }
1584 break;
1585
1586 case TERMACK:
1587 case TERMREQ:
1588 if (len > 0 && *p >= ' ' && *p < 0x7f) {
1589 printer(arg, " ");
1590 print_string((char *)p, len, printer, arg);
1591 p += len;
1592 len = 0;
1593 }
1594 break;
1595 }
1596
1597 /* print the rest of the bytes in the packet */
1598 for (; len > 0; --len) {
1599 GETCHAR(code, p);
1600 printer(arg, " %.2x", (int) (unsigned int) (unsigned char) code);
1601 }
1602
1603 return p - pstart;
1604}
1605#endif /* ifdef IPX_CHANGE */
1606
